definition: to shiver/to tremble
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
dozen (loanword)
to tremble/to shiver/to shake/to vibrate/Taiwan pr. [zhan4]

sentences.english: Tamitha, who had diabetes and ulcers, began to tremble.
sentences.chinese: 患有糖尿病和溃疡的塔米莎不禁冷得开始打颤。

sentences.english: She covered her mouth with her hand, another wave of chills flowing over her as her knees literally knocked together.
sentences.chinese: 她用手捂住嘴，又一阵恶寒让她全身发抖，膝盖打颤。

sentences.english: Outside the wind was so I put my whole body shrinks up, teeth, but keep tremble.
sentences.chinese: 外面的风吹得我把全身缩了起来，牙齿却不停打颤。

sentences.english: Then we visit the Marriott Hotel, where we chill in the swimming pool.
sentences.chinese: 接下来我们去参观了万豪酒店，在游泳池里冻得打颤。

sentences.english: The chilly wind makes passers-by shiver all over.
sentences.chinese: 冷冽的寒风吹得路上的行人浑身打颤。

sentences.english: They were the whispers in the wind and the shiver down your spine.
sentences.chinese: 他们是风的耳语和那打颤下来你的背骨。

sentences.english: The cold of the northern mountains chills me to my old and weary bones.
sentences.chinese: 北方山脉寒冷得令我的老胳膊老腿直打颤。

sentences.english: My teeth were chattering, my lips blue.
sentences.chinese: 我牙关在打颤，嘴唇发紫。

sentences.english: She was visibly trembling and her voice was soft and uncertain.
sentences.chinese: 她可看见打颤并且她的声音是软和不定的。

sentences.english: Never mind if her teeth were chattering from life-threatening hypothermia.
sentences.chinese: 有他在就不用担心她会被冷的牙齿打颤。

sentences.english: Along with these physical changes, people often report feelings of shivers or chills.
sentences.chinese: 伴随着以上生理变化，人们还常反馈说会觉得打颤。

sentences.english: Why were his teeth chattering like that?
When the eunuchs saw me, their knees shook and they fell upon the ground in fear.
sentences.chinese: 而当宦官们见到我，则吓得膝头打颤，跌倒在地。

sentences.english: She rose from the bed on shaky legs, and stumbled over to the door.
sentences.chinese: 她用那两条打颤的腿从床上站起来。

definition: to shiver
to tremble/to shiver (of cold)/to shudder
to tremble/to shake/to shiver
to tremble/to shiver/uncontrolled shaking of the body
calf (back of the leg below the knee)
to shudder/to shiver/to shake/to tremble
to weaken/to go soft (at the knees)
to shudder/to tremble
to feel numb
to sift chaff/(fig.) to shake all over
variant of 戰慄|战栗[zhan4 li4]
to tremble/to shiver/to shake/to vibrate/Taiwan pr. [zhan4]
to tremble/shudder
to feel a chill (as an emotional response)/to feel cold (as a clinical symptom)
to tremble/to shake out/to reveal/to make it in the world
jaw/mandibular joint
